definition: to interrupt/to break off/to break (a bone)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: A finger or stylus interrupts the light beams and position is determined on the grid.
sentences.chinese: 一只手指或者尖笔打断轻的梁，位置是决定闸极栏。

sentences.english: Her loud voice cut across their conversation.
sentences.chinese: 她的高嗓门打断了他们的谈话。

sentences.english: I went on talking, though continually interrupted by George.
sentences.chinese: 我继续讲我的，心管一直被乔治打断。

sentences.english: Also allow them to interrupt each other.
sentences.chinese: 而且可以让他们互相打断对方的话。

sentences.english: True documentarians don't try to interrupt the process of the subject.
sentences.chinese: 真正的记录片不会试图打断主题的进程。

sentences.english: The debate was interrupted by a clamor of opposition.
sentences.chinese: 辩论被反对方的一声叫喊打断。

sentences.english: To the non-ADHD partner, the interruptions are disrespectful.
sentences.chinese: 对于没有患多动症的一方，打断就意味着不尊重。

sentences.english: Don't let blinking icons and pop-ups disrupt your work flow.
sentences.chinese: 不要让闪烁的图标和弹出的窗口打断你的工作流程。

sentences.english: “When someone speaks in a loud tone, girls interpret it as yelling, ” Chadwell says.
sentences.chinese: 当人们高声说话时，女孩会用叫喊打断他。

sentences.english: Do you have a princess drill, too?
sentences.chinese: 我打断他说，“你还有把公主钻吧？”

sentences.english: Man, it really pisses me off when people interrupt me like that.
sentences.chinese: 哼，如果我被别人那样打断的话，我就会特别生气。

sentences.english: His frustration was interrupted when the gargoyle from the roof came crashing through the ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 城主的挫败感被一个从房顶穿过入室的恶魔打断了。

sentences.english: He was knocked out cold and thought his jaw was broken.
sentences.chinese: 他被打昏了，而且以为自己的下颌被打断了。

definition: to interrupt (sb speaking)/interruption/digression
to interrupt (sb talking)/to butt in/to cut into a conversation
questioning (a suspect)/interrogation
Shut up!/same as 閉上嘴巴|闭上嘴巴
to utter/to give voice
interruption/to interrupt (esp. talk)/to change the subject
to stop/to halt
to wave one's hand/to gesture with one's hand (beckoning, waving good-bye etc)/to swing one's arms
to reply
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 喝斥[he1 chi4]
to diverge/to branch off the road/to change (the subject)
subject (under discussion)/thread (of an argument)
to open one's mouth/to start to talk
impatience/impatient
to wait a moment/later/in awhile
to stand up
